newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -Bunds to rally before test of 100.63 prop.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -Bunds to rally before test of 100.63 prop.

text.p: The June Bund future on LIFFE will try to push up to the 101.10 area on Friday before sliding to test support around Thursday's low at 100.63, technical analysts said.

"The price action is obviously pretty weak...but I'm not sure that the market can hold further losses for very long," said Karl Haeling, director of futures and options at DMG Futures and Options in Frankfurt.
"We can go down, but are we vulnerable to a short covering rally after we trade lower?"
By 0646 GMT, the June Bund was up 15 basis points at 100.88.
Haeling said the contract had the chance to trade up towards 101.00, 101.10. "But I think it's going to run into resistance there and come back to test the downside."
He put support at Thursday's low of 100.63, then a further prop around 100.50, where the market started to break out to the upside in late April.
Geert-Jan Nikken, technical analyst at ABN-AMRO in Amsterdam, said if the market took out 100.63, it would target 100.40, the 61.8 percent retracement of the recent uptrend.
"Every high tick for the moment is a new short opportunity," said Nikken.
"The market gets more bearish every day. I wouldn't be surprised if we test 100.40 today."
Nikken said weekly charts showed a potential head and shoulders pattern beginning to form, with a neckline at 99.00 and a potential target at 94.00.
"On weekly charts, we can definitely see a reversal pattern beginning to form -- but we're not that far along yet," he said.
By 0720 GMT, September Euromarks were up one basis point at 96.73.
